Dismissed previously because it isn't worth the effort, as in most cases the calculation has to be done anyhow. However if really every event which would trigger a calculation is covered (which is done more easily with an event bus) there would be a lot of potential for speed ups by not having to run a lot of background threads to update UI state. Show list next episode (goal: update only single shows as needed): After any updates to a single show (TVDb and trakt): episode or just description can change Potentially if marking an episode watched/unwatched anywhere Season watch counters (goal: update only single season counters as needed): If marking an episode watched/unwatched anywhere After any updates to that show (TVDb and trakt sync) How granular should we go? Only tell that a part of a show, a season or even an episode was updated?

Manager.description: I really like the idea of trakt syncing in SeriesGuide. While SeriesGuide is my preferred tool for organizing my viewing, mirroring that history to an online, shared database with social features has a certain appeal. However, the reality of the current trakt syncing feature as it exists in SG v.30.0.1(Database v38) falls somewhat short of that ideal, and is making me consider disabling the trakt syncing just to restore some usability to SeriesGuide. Here's my typical SeriesGuide experience, with AutoUpdate enabled and SeriesGuide connected to trakt (only, not Cloud): Launch the SeriesGuide app, which usually takes me to Recent as that's the tab I was last viewing. The spinner at the top of the tab begins twirling as SeriesGuide starts syncing with trakt. Various shows begin transiently appearing in the list, as SeriesGuide "resets" their watched status before applying the state downloaded from trakt. (This is bug #487) If I attempt to mark any episodes (of any show) as Watched during the syncing process, those watched flags will more often than not be lost by SeriesGuide when it finishes syncing. (This may relate to bug #458 @pironic writes "Occasionally I find that under some conditions outside of the SeriesGuide pervue, shows and movies are scrobbled twice.", but I find that most of my duplicate activity is caused by SeriesGuide, when it loses Watched flags and I re-apply them, only to later find out that I've created duplicates.) Several minutes after syncing starts (this is no exaggeration the syncing spinner can last anywhere from 45 seconds to 2, 3+ minutes), the update completes and I am able to make changes in SeriesGuide without them being lost. I realize that what SeriesGuide can do in syncing with trakt is constrained by the trakt API, and that ideal efficiency may not be possible given those constraints. But I feel like something at least needs to be done to make the syncing (a) more asynchronous and (b) less disruptive, so that SeriesGuide can be used while it's going on. The situation in bug #487 where SeriesGuide manipulates the live datastore during the syncing process, removing and reapplying the entire Watched history for a show instead of simply making updates feels like a prime candidate for refactoring and improvement. As some data points on my situation, SeriesGuide is running on a Samsung Galaxy S4, not exactly a slow or resource-starved device. (And I'm running SlimKat 9.0, a CyanoGen-based Android 4.4.4 not Samsung's dog-slow stock OS.) It connects to the internet over Sprint's 4G LTE network in New York City, which typically gives me SpeedTest numbers of 6 - 12 Mbps down, 4 - 6 Mbps up. In every sense, performance is as good as can reasonably be expected. To give you an idea of my datastore, this is what SeriesGuide is working with: So, I'm far from a light user. It's entirely possible that I simply have too much data in SeriesGuide, and syncing it all to trakt is just too intensive a process. However, most of those shows are fully watched and Hidden, simply there for historical reasons. There's no reason to expect that they'd be receiving updates. If necessary I can delete the historical data from SeriesGuide, though it would be preferable if that info could simply be excluded from the syncing process in some way, rather than having to be discarded. It's also possible that having active shows on my list like Saturday Night Live (41 seasons / 810 episodes and counting) and The Simpsons (27 seasons / 602 episodes and counting) makes the syncing process unduly heavy. But, short of canceling those shows, I'm not sure what I can really do about that, so if that is indeed a problem then it would appear to be another way in which the syncing process is ripe for improvement. (I haven't even considered adding really high-volume shows like The Daily Show to SeriesGuide, even though I do watch it regularly.) SeriesGuide is a really great tool, and the trakt integration, while intriguing, would be a wonderful feature if only it didn't interfere so greatly with the app's performance and utility.
Manager.title: Trakt syncing (with large history?) is slow, disruptive, can cause data loss

Manager.description: Regarding the new popup menu displayed after pressing the tick icon; please consider removing it, adding an option to disable it, or making the popup menu only show up after long pressing the tick icon. The default action for the tick icon since it's creation has been setting an episode as watched and the addition of this popup menu does nothing more but add an extra step to the process of doing this. Myself and from what I can tell many other users do not use the "check in" or even the entire collections features meaning that it really does absolutely nothing but add an extra step to what used to be a 1 button process. I'd also like to point out that "set watched" isn't even the first item on the popup menu making it really easy to accidentally press the wrong menu item since it's between two others. I personally don't update all the episodes I've seen right after I've seen them meaning that when I do enter the app I'm planning on setting quite a lot of episodes as watched and this popup menu quite frankly makes it a really annoying pain in the butt. It doesn't help that the popup menu actually covers up the next episode that I want to set as watched so I have to search for the icon again and try not to be too fast or else oops I just added it to my collection. I'll also point out that when I opened the app today to set episodes as watched I managed to accidentally add an episode to my unused collection because I pressed the tick icon expecting it to do what it's always done but instead causing the popup menu to show up over the next tick icon I wanted to press causing "add to collection" to be selected instead. I can go on and on about how much I absolutely despise this feature and want it to burn if you need more motivation to kill it. Though trying to be a bit more level headed, I think it would just be a better idea if you made the popup menu show up on long press of the tick icon instead of changing the default action that icon has had since I believe forever.
Manager.title: Dealing with the new popup menu
